system.description: The standard currency of the Imperium of Man. On Barovus, Thrones retain their value but are scarce â€” inflated by isolation and the absence of regular trade routes. Adjust quantity as Thrones are earned or spent.
An encrypted short-range communication device worn in the ear, with an effective range of 10km. Standard Inquisitorial field equipment.
A hand-held sensor device capable of detecting energy emissions, life signs, and other readings within 50m. Grants +20 to Awareness tests within range.
A portable illumination source. Glow-globes hover and provide ambient light, while stab-lights are hand-held directional torches.
A pack of mildly narcotic cigarettes, widely used across the Imperium. A common vice among soldiers and hive-dwellers alike.
A timepiece, ranging from simple mechanical watches to sophisticated multi-function chronometers.
A compact multi-function tool containing various implements useful for technical work. Grants +10 to Tech-Use tests.
A portable data storage and display device, similar to a tablet computer. Used for storing documents, maps, and other information.
A collection of specialised torture implements and drugs designed for extracting information from unwilling subjects. Grants +20 to Interrogation tests.
Small nasal plugs that filter out airborne toxins, pollutants, and contaminants. Grants +20 to tests to resist gas-based effects.
A makeshift shield constructed from flak materials. Can be used to provide improvised cover in combat.
A 50-metre climbing line with a grapnel launcher. Can be fired to reach high or distant anchor points for climbing or crossing gaps.
A personal slow-fall device used for aerial insertion. Employs anti-gravitic technology to allow safe descent from great heights or aircraft.
Optical goggles that allow the wearer to see in darkness using infra-red vision, revealing heat signatures and outlines.
An industrial-grade cutting laser designed for slicing through metal and bulkheads. Can be repurposed as an improvised weapon in desperate situations.
Long-range magnifying viewing device capable of detailed observation at distances exceeding 1km. Often includes low-light enhancement.
Heavy metal restraints used to bind prisoners. Requiring a Challenging (+0) Strength test or Difficult (-10) Security test to break or pick.
A medical kit containing bandages, synth-skin, counterseptics, and other supplies. Grants +10 to Medicae tests. Contains 5 uses before requiring restocking.
An advanced electronic lockpicking device capable of interfacing with most standard Imperial locks. Grants +30 to Security tests to open locks.
A portable video and audio recording device. Used for surveillance, documentation, and evidence gathering.
Advanced thermal vision goggles that allow the wearer to see heat signatures through smoke, darkness, and other visual obstructions.
A sealed breathing apparatus that provides clean air in toxic atmospheres, underwater, or in vacuum for a limited duration.
A personal energy shield that disperses incoming energy across its surface. Provides a 30% chance to negate a hit entirely. Rare and highly valued.
A holy energy shield in the form of a sacred icon of the Ecclesiarchy. Provides a 50% chance to negate a hit. Extremely rare and zealously guarded.
A noise dampening field generator that absorbs sound in a small area around the user. Grants +30 to Stealth tests against sound-based detection.
Basic wilderness survival gear including a water purification tab, fire starter, a knife, a basic shelter tarp, and protein rations.
Protective eyewear that automatically darkens in response to bright light, protecting the wearer against flash grenades and blinding effects.
A vacuum-sealed suit designed for operations in the void of space. Provides life support, thermal regulation, and mag-boots for zero gravity environments.
A climbing harness with clip attachments for rappelling down vertical surfaces or descending from aircraft.
A sturdy pack for carrying additional equipment. Increases the amount of gear a character can carry comfortably.
A fine Imperial alcoholic drink distilled from wine or other spirits. Considered a luxury among the lower classes and a staple among the nobility.
A potent hallucinogenic drug that sends the user into a euphoric trance. Highly addictive and illegal on most Imperial worlds.
A powerful drug that rapidly purges toxins, poisons, and other chemical substances from the body. Causes brief nausea but is highly effective.
A combat drug that induces a state of frenzied aggression in the user. The subject becomes fearless and fights with reckless abandon.
A combat stimulant that heightens reflexes and aggression. Grants +3 to Agility and Weapon Skill bonuses for the duration of combat.
A rare psychic drug that temporarily grants the user minor psychic abilities, or enhances existing ones. Extremely dangerous for non-psykers.
A powerful medicinal stimulant injected to keep a wounded combatant fighting. Allows the user to ignore the effects of Critical damage for 1d10 rounds.
Blessed machine oils and consecrated lubricants used by Tech-Priests in rituals of maintenance. Grants +10 to a single Tech-Use test.
A personal focus item attuned to a psyker's mind, such as a crystal, staff, or talisman. Grants +10 to Focus Power tests.
A basic writing kit containing pens, ink, parchment, and sealing wax. Essential for scribes, adepts, and anyone needing to record information.
A small religious trinket or icon of the Imperial Creed. Carried by the faithful for spiritual comfort and as a ward against the forces of Chaos.
